snippet: A look at five breakout actors from the season.
abstract: Actors Lea Seydoux, Anders Danielsen Lie, Dwight Henry, Ann Dowd and Omar Sy have breakout performances in summer movies. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: Léa Seydoux, 'Farewell, My Queen' At 26 the French actress Léa Seydoux already has a foothold in the rarefied world of auteur cinema and the crossover realm of the blockbuster. She began her career in the nervier sectors of French film, working with Catherine Breillat, Bertrand Bonelloand Christophe Honoré. Mr. Honoré's ''Belle Personne'' won her a César (the French Oscar) nomination for most promising actress in 2009, and she has since made a considerable dent in the Hollywood consciousness, last year seducing Owen Wilson in ''Midnight in Paris'' and plotting to kill Tom Cruise in ''Mission: Impossible -- Ghost Protocol.'' It doesn't hurt that fashion designers and editors love her (she was the face of a recent Prada campaign), and that the movie business is in her blood. (Her grandfather is a chairman of one major French film company, Pathé, and her great-uncle is the president of another, Gaumont.)
